item.title: Keeping in mind the story and building a promising future
item.description: By Liu Xianfa* This year is the 80th anniversary of the victory in the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and world antifascist war. The War of Resistance of the Chinese people against Japanese aggression and the anti -fascist war are decisive battles between good and evil, light and darkness, and the progressive and the reactionary. From 1931 to 1945, the Chinese people, having fought for 14 years, won the great victory of their resistance war against Japanese aggression and the complete victory of the anti -fascist World War with all people lovers of the world. This year also marks the 80th anniversary of Taiwan's recovery of the Japanese occupation. Taiwan's recovery to China is a victorious result of World War II, an integral part of the International Post-Warning Order, and a great victory of all the Chinese people, including our compatriots in Taiwan, through their successive efforts and bloody battles. The fundamental role of the Communist Party of China is the key to victory in the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression Throughout the course of the war, the Communist Party of China has always been at the front line and assumed its responsibilities, exercising strong political leadership and boosting the formation of a historical current of resistance from the whole nation. China is the main eastern battlefield in the world anti -fascist war. The Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression was an important part of the anti -fascist World War and contributed decisively to the victory of the world antifascist war. In this devastating war, the War of Resistance of the Chinese people against Japanese aggression began earlier, lasted longer, defeated the largest number of enemies and made the greatest sacrifice. In 1931, the Japanese imperialists blatantly launched an attack on the city of Shenyang staged by the Japanese Kwantung army, known by the September 18 incident, which is 8 years before the Nazi Germany Blitzkrieg in Poland and 10 years before the attack on Pearl Harbor. By then, Chinese soldiers and civilians had already fired the first shot in the anti -fascist war and tirelessly fought in the cold plains of northeast China. During the blacks of the resistance war, China immobilized almost 70% of the Japanese army and thus helped allied forces in other theaters to obtain vital strategic opportunities. During their 14 years of war, the Chinese people made huge national sacrifices and paid a high price. According to incomplete statistics, the number of victims of the Chinese military and civilians exceeded 35 million, representing approximately one third of the total victims during World War II. Direct economic loss was over US $ 100 billion, and the indirect economic loss of more than $ 500 billion. Macao is never absent from this war and fights side by side with his homeland all the time All sectors of Macao society spared no effort and have surpassed all the difficulties in providing help, such as accommodation, food and medical care, to a large number of war -moved compatriots. Patriotic figures of Macao, such as Mr. Ma Man-Kei, Mr. Ho Yin and Dr. Ke Lin, broke the heavy blocks from the Japanese invaders and sent groceries and backgrounds to the front line. A legion of Macau's passionate young people left without hesitation for the Batalha fronts at the River of Pérolas, Dongjiang and other zones. Patriotic groups raised huge sums of money to support soldiers on the front line and made great efforts to promote resistance war advertising. The Yellow River Cantata, composed by the musician of the people of origin of Macau, Mr. Xian Xinghai, sounded the roar of national danger and became the strongest voice of national salvation. History will never forget the indelible contributions made by Macao to national independence and the liberation of the Chinese people, nor will it forget the deep feeling of patriotism and national rectitude of compatriots in Macao. Adopt a correct historical perspective, which is peaceful, just, comprehensive and objective, about the history of World War II The story cannot be tampered with and the facts should not be deleted. Even today, moved by geopolitical interests, there are some countries and politicians who are still trying to ignore historical facts, intentionally minimizing China's important contributions to World War II as the main eastern battlefield, embellishing colonial rule and even directly denying the history of fascist aggression and brutal crimes committed by the Japanese army. Such negligible and shameful acts represent challenges to the United Nations Charter, the International Postwar Order, the human consciousness, and the peoples of all victorious nations. The 1.4 billion Chinese will never tolerate any attempt to manipulate the history of World War II. China, along with peace -loving peoples around the world, will fight to the end against all unlawful acts that distort, glorify or deny the history of aggression and together will safeguard historical truth and defend world peace. Unite to build a community with a future shared for humanity The United Nations International System as its nucleus is a concentrated reflection of the victory of World War II, and serves as a basic stone for the international postwar order. As a permanent member of the UN Security Council, China is always an indispensable and important force in maintaining world peace. China will never follow the old path of some countries that have achieved modernization through war, colonization and looting. Instead, China will remain firmly on the right side of history and the progress of human civilization, and will keep the flag of peace, development, cooperation, and mutually beneficial. China's proposals to build a community with a shared future for humanity and other important concepts and initiatives are a continuation and development of the valuable experience of victory in World War II and contributed to wisdom and Chinese solutions to the promotion of human peace and development. China will work unshably with the international community to practice the vision of global governance of broad consultation and joint contribution to shared benefit, implement global security initiative, global development initiative and global civilization initiative, and build a community with a shared future for humanity. As President Xi Jinping pointed out, "war is like a mirror, looking at him helps us to better appreciate the value of peace." We must learn from history, especially from the harsh lessons of World War II, extract wisdom and strength of the great victory of anti -fascist World War and strengthen our determination to safeguard peace and consolidate security to jointly build a brighter future for humanity. We believe that all sectors in Macau will firmly take the noble patriotic tradition and the great spirit of the resistance war, thus contributing to the constant and comprehensive development of the principle of “a country, two systems”, to the realization of the complete reunification of the homeland and the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation! *Commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Popular Republic of China in the Special Administrative Region of Macau

item.title: Robotic rental belly (i)
item.description: This year was held in the mainstanding robotic Games World, with the presentation of Badminton competitions, basketball and speed events played between robots. These innovative technological achievements were surprisingly overshadowed by another news: the robotic rental belly. In August, several media announced the news that researchers from a reputed university institution in Singapore, in collaboration with other institutions, were working on the first robot that could function as a rental belly: the "robot mother." If successful, the mother robot may give birth to a baby. The mother robot measures 1.65 m and has the appearance of a woman. Innovation implies the implant at the location corresponding to the uterus of a fertilization system based on bio-engineering and artificial intelligence. Subsequently, sperm and eggs will be inoculated, fertilization occurs and the mother robot can “give birth” a baby. Information made available online indicates that the mother robot can cost about 100,000 rmbs. Sequoia Capital and the Tencent Conglomerate have already invested 230 million RMBs in the project. The mother robot is expected to be released this year. The mother robot will have a human uterus. Since much research on artificial uteros have been developing in a hospital in Philadelphia, USA. The system, called “Extend”, consists of a biological bag that contains a sterilized fluid and can lodge an embryo and tubes that provide you with nutrients and oxygen. In 2017, the hospital experienced the embryo of a sheep, in a state of development equivalent to a human embryo from 23 to 24 weeks, and the lamb was born after four weeks in the hospital. In 2021, the First Affiliatred Hospital at the University of Zhengzhou, China, made a successful experience successfully, also through the implant of sheep embryos in artificial uteros. On September 19, 2023, the US Food and Drug Administration held an independent consulting meeting to discuss the eventual approval of the first worldwide clinic designed to test “artificial uteros” technology for human beings pregnancy. For an artificial uterus to work, it must maintain a constant temperature, provide oxygen and nutrients, eliminate feces and prevent infections. With current technologies, it is possible to maintain a constant temperature, but other requirements have to be perfected gradually. Therefore, the launch of the mother's robot market next year will depend on the technological advances that can be obtained to maximize the five functions of the human womb. More insightful people have realized that when research for the mother robot starts, they will imply significant social changes and controversy. If a human being is born of a mother robot, the first question will be who will pay “the expenses of delivery?” And how much will these expenses be assembled ”? The first answer is easy, it will naturally be the child's parents. The main reason that will lead them to this method will be any health problem that prevents the mother from getting pregnant and, after medical counseling, uses the help of the mother robot. If the embryo that grows inside the mother robot is the result of insemination of the biological mother's egg by the sperm of the father, there will probably not have great controversy. But if this embryo is not originated by the couple's genetic material? What happens next? For example, if a couple donate sperm and eggs and then man dies in an accident and later the woman gets married with another man, can the new husband inherit the status and parental rights of the biological father? An even more complex scenario involves a single father or single mother, two men, or two women who will have to use eggs or sperm from a third person to give rise to the embryo that will grow in the "belly" of the mother robot and then have to be adopted. In either case, the law is fundamental. Must regulate the following: 1. Is the use of the mother robot cool? 2. If it's cool, can we use the mother robot? 3. How is a mothers robot company to operate. Next week, we will approach these three questions in detail. item.title: CCM Square welcomes installation “The Tower of Time”
item.description: Already installed in the square of the Cultural Center of Macau (CCM) the installation "The Tower of Time", integrated in the initiative "Art Macau: International Biennial of Macau 2025", which has been presenting more than 30 exhibitions in six sections for several months. According to a note from the IC, the installation "The Tower of Time" aims to celebrate the "cultural bond between cities of East Asia" and was prepared by "three consecrated artists from China, Japan and South Korea." These are “reference figures in Asian contemporary art”, being Guan Huaibin, “famous Chinese contemporary artist and specialist in artistic facilities and spatial multimedia art”. Hirotoshi Sakaguchi, “famous Japanese artist and honorary professor at Tokyo University of Art”, also made his contribution. In the case of this artist, he has already carried out “works that cover various means, including painting and landscape art”. In this installation, the South Korean contemporary artist Kim Sang-Youon also collaborated, "whose creation is deeply influenced by eastern philosophy and focuses on issues related to the coexistence between man and nature." “Lighthouse of the soul” "The Tower of Time" combines, according to the IC, "eastern philosophy over time and space with the language of contemporary art, surpassing the limitations of physical space." Thus, a "lighthouse of the soul" is built that "incorporates both historical depth and future tensions." “Through poetic form in the flow of light and shadow, the work stimulates the sensory interaction between the public and the installation, to jointly build individual and collective memories, inspires the meaning of life and eternity, becoming an artistic framework that inscribes the cultural friendship between the cities of eastern Asia,” also describes IC. This installation is part of the “Public Art Exhibition” Biennial section, subject to the theme “Waves and Paths”. item.title: Concert | Rapper Travis Scott arrives in late October
item.description:
American rapper Travis Scott brings to Macau his tour of “Circus Maximus World Tour 2025”, a concert is expected to be scheduled for October 29 in the Cotai concert zone created by the government, “Macao outdoor shows”. Scott will also be present in other Asian cities
For more than a year, American rapper Travis Scott walks the road on a tour with “Circus Maximus World Tour 2025” and this time the stopped stop of the lyricist and musician is Macau. Two years ago, the rapper took to the stage the “Utopia - Circus Maximus” tour, only in North America, but has now decided to continue with the world's shows, including in Europe and Asia. The artist's show is scheduled for October 29th in the Cotai area, at the “Macao Outdoor Show Location”, with tickets set for sale from September 5th. Success has marked Travis's career, and this tour now promises to bring fans of the rap musical genre and the general public a great audiovisual experience. The tour starts in Brazil, more specifically in Sao Paulo, on September 6, then made a journey through South Africa, India and South Korea, followed, after the action in Macao, shows in Sanya, China, Japan and Abu Dabi. This tour is born from the release in 2023 from the album “Utopia”, considered the best-selling hip-hop album this year, having been in the first place in the Billboard Top 200 for four consecutive weeks. In addition, when it comes to streaming platforms used to listen to music, Utopia recorded over 50 billion streams worldwide, and the Spotify platform considered Scott's album the most heard in the first week of 2023. Also Apple Music confirmed that this album hit records like more heard on the 2023 release day. Success since 2013 "Utopia" features tracks such as "Thank God", "Hyaena", "Modern Jam", "My Eyes" or "God's Country", having Travis Scott received a nomination for a Grammy, considered the most important prizes in the music industry. Within the hip-hop universe Travis Scott is a name to retain. Born in the Houston area by the name of Jacques Berman Webster II, the rapper adopted this stage name and began exploring trap style changes with a much more melodic and experimental approach. In this way, the artist, who is also a music producer, has managed to fuse several sounds such as rap, hip-hop or R&B. Travis Scott is considered one of the most influential artists of the new generation of American rap taking into account the use of so-called self-tone and use of dense drums, also exploring the visual language side that your music can present. The appointment for a Grammy with "Utopia", his fourth studio album, was not, however, the only one. The artist had been named eight times throughout a career that began to form seriously from the first major release in 2013. First, the “Owl Pharaoh” album project emerged in the market, followed, in 2014, the “Days Before Rodeo”. These two projects would give rise to the studio -produced debut album, simply titled “Rodeo”, released precisely ten years ago. Then Travis Scott began to know some success in terms of sales and recognition of critics. But the release of “Birds in the Trap Sing Mcknight” in 2016 began to consecrate him as an artist, who for the first time had an album hers to enter the Billboard 200 list. In addition to his music work, Travis Scott also created Cactus Jack Foundation. It is a non-profit organization that has the mission of supporting young people in the area where it was born, Houston, with toy collection campaigns, scholarship programs for university students and support in the payment of expenses related to education and creative projects.

item.title: Creative Macau celebrates 22nd anniversary with new exhibition
item.description: It is now inaugurated in the Creative Macau gallery a new show that aims to celebrate the entity's 22nd anniversary, and simply calls itself “22”. In the show, which is evident until September 27 this year, are revealed works by local artists or names linked to previous projects of Creative Macau, such as Alice Costa (Lili), Angel Chan, Coco Cheong Ut Man, Cristina Lu, David Chio, Denis Murrell, Elisa Vilaça, Gigi Lee, Irene Chio, Joan Lam, Justin Chiang, Justin Ung, Ken C.I. Chau, Law Sao I, Leong Leng, Li Li, Liesl Lee, Lúcia Lemos, M.Chow, Maria João das, Mavin Zin, Ng Cheok Ieng and Yaya goes. In this collective exposure, a reference to the philosophical concept of tautology is made, which corresponds to a language addiction that leads to unnecessary repetition of unintentional terms and expressions. Thus, the works exposed at Creative Macau contain various forms of expression of the “everyday language” when “unintentional tautologies” are used. In this case, where the use of tautology in the field of arts is used, this becomes “an expressive and inspiring technique”, where “the possibilities” of this repetition of language are explored to realize whether “it is a limitation or liberation”, or “a meaningless repetition or a self-affirmation with hidden meanings”. According to a note by Creative Macau, this exhibition “brings together artists who used various means to present 'tautology', challenging the novelty of language and image, and inspiring multiple perspectives”. It is intended, with the exposed works, to “find depth within repetition” and provoke a “rethink of the essence of 'meaning'”, leading the audience to discover themselves in “simplicity”. Philosophical concept In tautology there are repeated utterances, the same concepts said differently and with different words. There is, in logic, the symbol “⊤” as a representation “of a true proposition that only depends on internal coherence and is independent of external conditions”. It seems, at the outset, that these repeated statements are empty, but in fact "contain a 'variant in repetition'." Basically, these works of art intend to respond to the idea or possibility of “meaning to be transformed into different contexts”. According to the organizers of “22”, “the repeated presentation of elements in art challenges our expectations of 'meaning', leading us to question whether understanding is always built from repeated symbols and languages”. "Perhaps, only through repetition, we can see subtle differences," is mentioned.

item.title: Lecture | Xu Bing, Chinese contemporary artist, stars in conference
item.description:
The Cultural Institute will hold, next month, a lecture in which the main figure is the Chinese artist of contemporary art Xu Bing. The conference, with the name “The Unstopless Era has arrived!” It is part of the initiative “Lecture on Aesthetics”, integrated in the “Month of Cultural Promotion”
Xu Bing, one of the most important and recognized contemporary Chinese artists, will be in Macao on September 7 to present the lecture “The Era without coordinates has arrived!”. This is an initiative of the Cultural Institute (IC) entitled “Lecture on Aesthetics”, being “one of the main activities” of the “Cultural Promotion Month”. The conference takes place at 3 pm in the conference room of the Macao Cultural Center, where Xu Bing will “share the evolution of his thinking in recent years, reflect and judge in conjunction with the Macao audience”, namely “The Possibilities of Art in the Light of New Technologies, through their animation in Stop Motion‘ Lake Satellite ””, which is the first artistic project filmed in space. The work is exhibited at this year's International Art Biennial of Art. The artist is described as someone who has been dedicated in recent years "to widen the limits of art with his works, and is widely recognized as one of the main conceptual artists in the areas of linguistics and semiotics of current." The lecture this time will be conducted in Mandarin, with simultaneous translation for Portuguese and English, being suitable for participants aged 15 years or more, with no places marked. Registration is now open and can be made on the “Macao Unique Account” platform. This is not the first time Xu Bing has come to the territory to show his art and talk about his work. In 2017, at the Macao Art Museum, the show “The Language and Art of Xu Bing” was inaugurated, in what was the artist's first solo exhibition in Macau. There were 30 “important” works of the artist, namely “Book of Heaven” and “Book of Earth”.
Long career Xu Bing was born in Chongqing, China, in 1955, but grew up in Beijing. His connection to the arts began in 1977, when he entered the department of engraving of Beijing Central Academy of Fine Arts, having completed his studies in 1981. Then he taught in this department. In 1987 Xu Bing obtained the title of Master by the same institution. In recognition of his achievements, he was invited to the US in 1990 as an honorary artist, having received in 1999 a distinction, MacArthur Fellowship, the largest creative talent prize in the US. In 2004, he received the first arts prize Mundi, while in 2018 he was awarded the Xu Bei Hong award - Cafa Artistic Creation. Xu Bing returned to China in 2007, having taken several leadership positions at the Central Academy of Fine Arts, including those of vice president, professor and doctoral advisor. Since 2014 it acts as president of the institution's Academic Committee. Currently, he divides his time between Beijing and New York, where he lives and works, being a professor at the Central Academy of Fine Arts of Beijing (Cafa). It is, therefore, the career of Xu Bing, which has works exposed in various artistic institutions, including the China National Art Museum, the Museum of Art, the New York Museum of Modern Art, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum and the British Museum, integrating multiple collections.

item.title: KAM PEK | Company profits that explores casino rise 48.5%
item.description:
Paradise Entertainment, which explores Kam Pek's casino, had a $ 172.5 million profits from Hong Kong in the first half of 2025, an annual climb of 48.5 percent. The company justified the results with revenues in the sale and management of services related to game equipment
The Paradise Entertainment group recorded in the first half of this year profits of $ 172.5 million from Hong Kong (HKD), which means an annual growth of 48.5 percent. The company's results, which explores the Kam Pek Casino in downtown Macao, were announced in a note sent to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. During the period under analysis, the company's revenues increased 19.4 percent compared to the first half of last year to 507.9 million HKD, while sales and services costs grew 7.3 percent to 179.3 million HKD. The company's results in the first half will be reflected in the distribution of dividends (0.075 HKD per action), in an accumulated amount of 78.9 million HKD, on October 15. In the statement sent to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, Paradise Entertainment explained the first semester results with “increasing revenue from casino management services and selling electronic game equipment and systems in Macao”, according to the GGR Asia portal. The margin of profits before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) of Paradise Entertainment in the first half was 211.8 million HKD, a value that represents a growth of 43.4 percent. Business Darwinism Despite the imminent closure of Kam Pek Casino, the company recorded revenues of 382.6 million HKD in the first half of this year, plus 7.3 percent in annual terms. In the field of activity related to electronic game equipment and systems, Paradise Entertainment had revenues of 125.3 million HKD, equivalent to an increase of 83.7 percent per year. In terms of EBITDA margin, the company's performance in the first half of this year than quadrupled the results of the first half of 2024, from 11.2 million HKD to 48.8 million HKD. The results of this Paradise Entertainment activity segment were justified by increasing revenues in sales and rental of electronic equipment, with particular emphasis on increasing demand and popularity of multi-game terminals that allow bets on various types of play, following in direct tables with croupiers and meat players and bone. These terminals allow multiple smaller value bets compared to real tables, adding game options to the mass segment. Despite the closure of the casino satellite, which operates under the SJM license, Paradise Entertainment said that industry development, moving away from the VIP segment, “is in close consonance” with its strategic objectives. In addition, the group has indicated that it will expand electronic game system services and equipment to Asian markets such as Philippines and Sri Lanka, as well as to northern America.

item.title: Ruins of São Paulo | IC says lightning rays can be removed
item.description:
Leong Wai Man, president of the Cultural Institute, said yesterday that the lightning rays installed in the ruins of São Paulo are reversible and do not impair the structure of the monument. The statements were made on the sidelines of a meeting of the Cultural Heritage Council
After all, the lightning rays installed near the ruins of São Paulo may be removed if there are other alternatives, not harming the structure of one of Macao's most iconic monuments. This confirmation arose from the president of the Cultural Institute (IC), Leong Wai Man, who on the fringes of a meeting of the Cultural Heritage Council explained to journalists that the lightning rods are reversible. According to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the official explained that its installation took place in a commitment solution after the IC requested an opinion from the Chinese Academy of Cultural Heritage, subordinate entity of the National Administration of Cultural Heritage. Leong Wai Man stated that questions such as the best method of installing the lightning rods were considered in order not to harm the landscape provided by the ruins. Despite considering that its installation may harm the visual side of the monument, Leong Wai Man stressed that there is a need to protect it against lightning. Thus, the fact that the lightning rods are reversible makes it a better solution in terms of protection and safety so that in the future they can be removed, decreasing the visual impact on the landscape of the ruins. Question Si Ka Lon It is recalled that the idea of ​​placing windshields next to the ruins of São Paulo came last year when a lightning hit the monument, which resulted in the fall of a facade stone, without being resulted in injuries. However, Deputy Si Ka Lon interpelled the government in July this year about whether this would indeed be the best solution. “Given the frequent occurrence of thunderstorms and the fragility of Macao's historical buildings, the government will proceed to a global assessment of the historical buildings of the Macao World Heritage, proceeding to uniform planning, inspection and maintenance of the system, and to reduce the risks coming from thunderstorms and ensure the safety of constructions and the safety of constructions and the safety of constructions and the safety of constructions and constructions and the safety of constructions and the safety of constructions and the safety of constructions and constructions and the safety of constructions and the safety of constructions and constructions and the safety of constructions and the safety and the safety of constructions and the safety of constructions and the safety and the safety of constructions and the safety and the safety of constructions and and the safety of constructions and the safety of constructions of residents? ”He asked. Si Ka Lon also highlighted the fact that the current technical regulation against fire and enclosure safety and enclosures, responsible for regulating the installation of lightning equipment, having some imperfections, asking the executive to “take as reference the interior practices of China in order to define more rigorous criteria for the update and maintenance of lightning protection facilities”. In response to the deputy, the direction of soil services and urban construction ensured that the lightning lightning was being installed “given the height, outside design, construction materials, environmental conditions surrounding and the height of the structures adjacent to the world heritage”. In the specific case of the ruins, and given “it is a historical monument, it was necessary to consider the specificities of the aspect and structure, as well as the location and the surrounding environment”, and information on different lightning technologies ”was collected in order to install an appropriate system. item.title: Ukraine | Russia interested in negotiations but maintains attacks
item.description: Russia yesterday rejected criticism from the European Union (EU) about the commitment to negotiations, claiming to be interested in seeking peace, but assured that it will continue to attack Ukraine until it reaches its objectives. "The Russian Armed Forces are fulfilling the mission. They continue to attack military and paramilitary targets," said Kremlin (Presidency) spokesman Dmitri Peskov, after criticism of the EU Kiev bombing that caused at least 14 dead and damaged the European embassy. "At the same time, Russia is still interested in continuing the negotiation process in order to achieve the objectives that were set by political and diplomatic means," he said, quoted by France-Presse (AFP) and Spanish EFE. At least 14 people died and 48 were injured yesterday morning in Kiev due to a 629 russian massive attack and missiles against Ukrainian territory, Ukrainian authorities said. The previous balance indicated by the local authorities was eight dead and 45 injured. Among the dead are three children, Ukrainian interior minister IHOR KLYMENKO said, citing preliminary data. The numbers are expected to increase, while the rescue teams remain on the ground to rescue people arrested under the rubble. It was the first major Russian attack on Kiev in weeks, while the United States lead peace efforts. According to the AFP news agency, Russia fired 598 drones and 31 ballistic and cruise missiles against Ukraine in a new massive attack during yesterday morning, citing data from the Ukrainian Air Force in a statement. According to preliminary data, 563 combat drones and distraction drones, as well as 26 missiles, were slaughtered or blocked, according to the Ukrainian Air Force. The attacks hit the central part of Kiev, one of the few times the Russian attacks have reached the heart of the Ukrainian capital since the start of the large -scale invasion in February 2022.

item.title: Pyongyang criticizes southern leader for speaking of denuclearization
item.description: North Korea yesterday criticized what it described as the hypocrisy of South Korea President Lee Jae-Myung when talking about the possible denuclearization of the Korean peninsula. Pyongyang said South Korea is the “only country that has delivered all sovereignty to the United States,” according to an editorial published by the North Korean state news agency KCNA. The North Korean agency, which transmits Pyongyang's official position on national and international politics, has lamented that Seoul is promoting "empty illusions about denuclearization." He reaffirmed that North Korea will never deliver the nuclear weapons it has. "Lee must understand that continuing to feed this dream about denuclearization will not help anyone," he said, according to the Spanish news agency Europa Press. North Korea again defended the possession of nuclear weaponry, which considered that the geopolitical situation in the region was inevitable. "Lee Jae-Myung has never hidden his true reasons: he is a maniac for confrontation," said KCNA. Lee said on Monday during a speech in Washington before President Donald Trump, who intends to work with the United States to "establish peace and achieve the denuclearization of the Korea Peninsula." A day later, Pyongyang again criticized the joint military maneuvers of the United States and South Korea in the region, ongoing 10 days ago, which described as hostile and demonstrations of the “desire to invade” the North Korean territory. "Everyone knows that this is not a defensive, especially from a country that has the largest nuclear arsenal," said Kim Yong-Bok, a high official of the North Korean army, in reference to the United States. Donald, the Peacemaker At the meeting with Lee, Trump said he liked to meet again with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, with whom he met in 2018 and 2019, and admitted that he could try a summit between the two Koreas. Trump asked Lee to resume dialogue with Pyongyang and opened a "new era of peace in the Korean Peninsula." Korea, which was colonized by Japan between 1910 and 1945, was divided by the United States and the Soviet Union in two administrative zones, separated by parallel 38, after World War II (1939-1945). From this division resulted in the Korean War (1950-1953), which opposed the popular Democratic Republic of Korea (North), supported by the Soviet Union and China, and the Republic of Korea (South), supported by an international force led by the United States. The armed conflict caused about 2.5 million dead, mostly Koreans, and ended with an armistice, but without a peace agreement, so technically Pyongyang and Seoul remain at war. The two Koreas remain divided by parallel 38, and a demilitarized zone near the village of Panmunjom was created, where the Armistício was signed on July 27, 1953.

item.description: Indian opposition classified Wednesday the new tariffs in the United States as “economic blackmail” and criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi, so he considers a failure of foreign policy that impairs national interests. “The 50 percent rate of [Donald] Trump is an economic blackmail: an attempt to press India to accept an unfair trade agreement,” wrote the leader of the Indian National Congress Party (INC), Rahul Gandhi, on social networks. Gandhi exhorted Modi to “not allow his weakness to prevail over the interests of the Indian people,” according to the Spanish news agency Efe. In the same line, InC president Mallikarjun Kharge said that “a solid foreign policy requires substance and skill” and classified Modi's diplomacy as a superficial. "They have not been able to reach a trade agreement and are now failing to protect our country," he criticized. The United States activated Wednesday the new 50 percent rates on India exports as a punishment for the purchase of oil to Russia, the target of sanctions due to the war against Ukraine. The new additional punitive rate is 25 percent. At issue, there are Indian exports of about $ 60 billion, according to EFE. Russia has already been ready to absorb Indian exports most affected by US punishment. The hardest affected sectors are industries with high employability, such as textile, jewelry and precious stones, seafood and car components. The United States has not punished sectors producing goods that are important to the companies themselves or the pocket of US citizens such as medicines and mobile phones. Oil factor US President Donald Trump initially announced a 25 percent rate on Indian products. But in early August, he signed an executive order imposing an additional 25 percent rate due to Russian oil purchases by India, which raised combined tariffs imposed on Asian ally allied to 50 percent. "Our [Russian oil] imports are based on market factors and are made with the general objective of ensuring the energy security of 1.4 billion people in India," said Nova Deli on August 7, the Hindustan Times newspaper recalled. To face the measure, the Indian government announced Wednesday the promotion of textile products in markets that considered priority, including those from the UK, Japan and South Korea. India exports currently reach 220 countries and territories, but authorities said that 40 markets are fundamental to diversification. The list also includes Germany, France, Italy, Spain, the Netherlands, Poland, Canada, Mexico, Russia, Belgium, Turkey, United Arab Emirates and Australia, according to The Times of India. The Federation of India Export Organizations (FIEO) expressed in a “maximum concern” statement and requested immediate government support from companies.

item.title: Hong Kong | Final allegations end in the case of the tycoon Jimmy Lai
item.description: The final allegations in the trial for national security violation of the media of media Jimmy Lai ended yesterday in Hong Kong, without being known the date of the verdict. Accused of sedition and collusion with foreign forces during the 2019 protests, of which he was one of the key figures, Jimmy Lai may face life imprisonment. Lai declared himself innocent in this long trial, which began in December 2023 and ended yesterday, with the final allegations, with no scheduled date for the verdict. “We will inform the parts in a timely manner” on the date, said Judge Esther Toh. Founder of the Liberal Journal Apple Daily, banned since June 2021, 77 -year -old Jimmy Lai has been arrested since 2020, being accused of having asked Western governments to have sanctions on China and the Special Administrative Region of Hong Kong due to the repression of protests on the streets of the former British colony. Lai is also accused of producing seditous articles and contents, namely in editorials he has signed. These two infractions are severely punished by the National Security Law adopted after the sometimes violent protests of 2019. The allegations took place over ten days after two postponements: one due to bad weather and another due to heart problems of Jimmy Lai. He eventually could watch the hearings after being medicated and equipped with proper medical equipment.

item.title: Cooperation | Russia and China perform first joint patrol with submarines
item.description: Russia and the Popular Republic of China first performed a joint submarine patrol mission in the Asia Pacific region, the Russian Navy Pacific fleet announced Wednesday. "The Pacific fleet 'Volkhov' submarine and a China Popular Liberation Army Submarine made a patrol trip in the seas of Japan and East China," said Russian force. The diesel-electrical submarines returned to their basis after joint exercise, said the Russian fleet in the statement, quoted by the Spanish news agency Efe. Volkhov returned to Vladivostoch base in the far eastern Russia after a trip of over 2,000 nautical miles. The joint patrol aimed to “reinforce naval cooperation” between Russia and China and “maintain peace and stability in the Asia-Pacific region,” said the Pacific Fleet Communication Office. He also aimed to “monitor the maritime area and protect the maritime economic activities of Russia and China,” he added, according to Russian news agency Ria Novii. During the mission, the Russian submarine, with 45 -day navigation autonomy and in service since October 2020, was supported by the “Gromki” corvette and the “Poti Krilov” rescue tug from the Pacific fleet. The joint submarine patrol began in early August, after the completion of the Russian-Chinese exercise “Maritime Interaction-2025” in the waters of the Sea of ​​Japan. Russian and Chinese marines have performed surface ships annually since 2021, Ria Novosti added.

item.title: Effective | China defends achievements from the end of World War II
item.description:
In the preparation of the Great Military Parade of September 3 that will bring to Beijing several world leaders, such as Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un, the Chinese government praises the victory over fascist regimes again
China wants to work with “all peace -loving countries” and defend the achievements of World War II, the Chinese government said yesterday, in the presentation of the 80th anniversary ceremonies of the end of the conflict. A military stop will mark on September 3, in Beijing, the end of World War II in Asia and the defeat of fascism. 80 years ago, with "huge sacrifices", China occupied "the main front in Asia in the fight against fascism" during World War II, in a "important historical contribution" to the victory of the allies, recalled the spokesman for the Chinese Ministry Guo Jiakun. Guo pointed out that, in that period, "many European countries and friends offered valuable assistance and even gave their lives, and their achievements will always be remembered by the Chinese people." So far, “close 50 responsible leaders, sent to China and friends from 30 European countries have confirmed the presence” in these celebrations in the country, reflecting a shared desire to “preserve historical memory and defend peace and justice,” he said. Asked about the absence of great Western powers, Guo replied that China organizes these events "to remember the story, honor the fallen, value peace and open the future." Presidential magazine Chinese President Xi Jinping will review the troops and speak at Tiananmen Square, in an event that will be attended by almost 30 heads of state and government, including Russian President Vladimir Putin, and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. The parade will end a sequence of events, including the summit of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, which will take place between August 31 and September 1, in Tianjin (northeast of China), announced as “the largest” since the foundation of the organization on June 15, 2001. World War II was parallel to the invasion of China through Japan (1931-1945) and the civil war between nationalists and communists in China (1927-1949), which established a truce to fight Japanese troops. The Japanese invasion caused more than 35 million casualties among Chinese troops and civilians until 1945, according to Beijing, representing a third of the casualties.

item.title: Hong Kong | Jimmy Lai Defense Purpose Final Allegations
item.description: Hong Kong Jimmy Lai's defense of the media of the media jimmy Lai continued yesterday the presentation of the final allegations in a trial followed by the international community. The hearing is surrounded by a large security device, which includes the presence of armed units and patrols with dogs outside the court, where at least a dozen official vehicles remain parked, according to local social media TA Kung Wen Wei. Lai, 77, founder of the now defunct Apple Daily newspaper and three companies linked to the same editorial group, faces an accusation of “conspiracy to print and reproduce seditious material” and two of “conspiracy with foreign or external forces to endanger national security”. The criminal frame applied to these accusations may lead to the businessman's life imprisonment. The final allegations phase began last week, in a process started in December 2023, marked by several postponements, including those registered in mid -August due to torrential rainfall and health problems of the accused. During this week's sessions, the defense focused on refutation allegations of the accusations that Lai orchestrated a coordinated strategy to promote international sanctions against Hong Kong and Beijing through articles published in Apple Daily and alleged support to the activist group known as "Stand with Hong Kong," Hong Kong's press. The entrepreneur's legal team argued that there is no evidence that Lai gave direct instructions to activists, nor that newspaper publications were incitement to sedition, insisting on the role of media “to facilitate public debate”. First detained in 2020, Lai has since remains in a maximum security prison and has been a penalty of five years and nine months for a different case.

item.title: Israel | Army says Gaza's evacuation is inevitable
item.description: Israel considered the evacuation of the city of Gaza yesterday in the context of the continuation of military operations in the Palestinian territory, given international criticism of the forced displacement of the population. "The evacuation of the city of Gaza is inevitable (…), each family that moves south will receive the most generous humanitarian aid as possible," said Army Arab spokesman Avichay Adraee, quoted by France-Presse news agency (AFP). The UN calculates in about one million people the current population of the province of Gaza, which includes the city of Gaza and the surrounding area in the northern Palestinian territory devastated by almost two years of war. Israel approved plans to take the city of Gaza and announced that it intends to force the population to transfer to the south of the territory, a project considered unrealistic and dangerous by humanitarian organizations. The Arabic press reported on Tuesday that Egypt positioned about 40,000 armed forces staff in northern Sinai, which borders the Gaza Strip for fears a mass escape to its territory. Papal appeals Yesterday, Pope Leo XIV called for the full respect of humanitarian law in Gaza, particularly relative to the “indiscriminate use of force and forced displacement of populations”, in a new appeal to the end of the war. The US pontiff made the appeal at the end of the general hearing in the Vatican City, asking the parts and the international community to commit to "ending the conflict in the Holy Land, which caused so much terror and death." The head of the Catholic Church has asked "that all [Israelite] hostages be released, that there is a permanent ceasefire, that the safe entry of humanitarian aid is made, and which fully respects humanitarian law." He mentioned “the obligation to protect civilians and the prohibition of collective punishment, the indiscriminate use of force and the forced displacement of populations,” according to the Spanish news agency Efe. Leão XVI also stated support for the joint statement made on Tuesday by the Greek, Teófilo III patriarchs, and Latin, Perbattista Pizzaballa, from Jerusalem. The patriarchs asked "the end of the spiral of violence, the end of the war, and the priority of the common good of all peoples." In the joint statement, they asked the Israeli authorities to suspend the plan to take Gaza and transfer the city's population to the south of the Gaza Strip. "This is not the right way. There is no reason to justify the deliberate and forced massive displacement of civilians," the ecclesiastical authorities said in a statement. They also announced that the clergy and nuns in Gaza decided to stay and continue to take care of all the people who found refuge at the facilities of the Christian churches. After nearly two years of war, the UN declared on August 22 a hunger situation in the province of Gaza in the north of the territory, which happens for the first time in the Middle East.

item.title: India / Pakistan | Rains kill 32 people dislodge thousands
item.description:
Sudden water loads above normal for the time caused chaos and destruction in various areas of India and Pakistan
Intense rainfall that hit parts of Pakistan and India caused 32 dead and an indefinite number of missing in the Indian part of Caxemira, the Indian authorities announced yesterday. The deaths and disappearances occurred in the Jammu region of India -controlled Caxemira, where sudden floods and landslide were recorded on a Hindu pilgrimage route, Press Trust of India (PTI) reported. The period when the deaths caused by floods were not immediately clear, according to the US Associated Press (AP) news agency. Punjab province authorities in eastern Pakistan, yesterday asked the army's help in rescue and help efforts after torrential rains have overflowed large rivers. Several locations were flooded and more than 150,000 people were displaced, authorities said. Rescue teams removed more than 20,000 people during Lahore's outskirts, Pakistan's second largest city, which also faced the risk of floods. People taken from the areas near Lahore lived along the Ravi River bed, said Punjab's disaster management authority, Irfan Ali Kathia. The departure of residents from the most vulnerable areas began earlier this week in six Punjab districts.
Suddenly The more intense than normal mronics rains and the liberation of water from the neighboring India caused sudden floods in low -altitude border regions, Kathia said. Meteorologists predicted that rain will continue throughout the region during the week. Striky rains and sudden floods in the Himalayan region killed almost 100 people in August. Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif praised local authorities for the timely removal of the population and said that emergency aid was being supplied to those affected by flooding, according to a government statement. India warned Pakistan about possible transfronist floods through diplomatic channels, rather than the Indian Water Commission, which is the permanent mechanism under the Treaty of the Il, mediated by the World Bank in 1960. Nova Delhi suspended the committee's work after the murder of 26 tourists in India -controlled Caxemira in April, although Islamabad insists that India cannot unilaterally terminate the treaty. The floods caused by the monsoon rains have killed more than 800 people in Pakistan since the end of June. Scientists claim that climate change is intensifying monsoon rains in southern Asia, increasing fears of a 2022 climate disaster repetition, which reached a third of Pakistan and killed 1,739 people. India is the country with the most population in the world, with more than 1.4 billion inhabitants, and Pakistan the fifth, with over 255 million. Monsoon designates seasonal winds related to the alternation between dry and rain stations in tropical and subtropical coastal regions. From June to September, monsoon rains take place in southern Asia countries, such as India, Pakistan, Vietnam, Thailand, Cambodia, Bangladesh and Laos, according to the National Center for US atmospheric Research. From December to February, the monsoon rains move south of Ecuador towards Australia, while southern Asia goes through dry season conditions.

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

item.title: Macao Forum | Secretary-General says it has never discussed widening to Hispanic countries
item.description:
In an interview with Lusa agency, the secretary general of the Macau Forum, Ji Xianzheng, assured that “never discussed” the widening of action to Hispanic countries, but that the willingness already stated by the government of Sam Hou Fai will have to be the authorities to decide a new direction to the cooperation strategy
The Secretary-General of the Macau Forum stated that the institution “never discussed” the creation of an entity to extend to Hispanic countries to promote economic cooperation similar to those that provide the connection between China and Portuguese-speaking countries. “Within the Macao Forum, we have never discussed this topic,” said the Forum Secretary-General for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries Ji Xianzheng. The official acknowledged that, "in society, there were some conversations to discuss or address the possibility of promoting more contact and cooperation with Spanish -language countries, but at the Forum level we have never addressed this theme." The Macao executive announced in mid -April the intention of creating a center to promote economic services between China and the Portuguese and Spanish languages ​​in the neighboring special Economic Zone of Hengqin. The idea is to provide companies in Hispanic countries services in the “linguistic, legal, fiscal, verification of compliance with norms, formation, arbitration and mediation”, according to the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong. Days earlier, the chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, had also announced the intention of “promoting exchange and cooperation” through Macao between China and the universe of Spanish -speaking countries. Although Macau wants to widen focus to Castilian -speaking countries, “the forum will remain the forum for China and Lusophony countries,” said Ji Xianzheng. The secretary general clarified that the institution that directs "can contribute contributions to the greater opening of Macao in international cooperation", as is the intention announced by the new government of MSAR. Complementary forum Personally, the secretary general has ensured that he had “pleasing to work with all parties,” but stressed that this is a “decision that is up to central governments to make” and that the forum was never contacted in this regard. "Yes, I worked in Latin America, Spain, nine years in Madrid and Caracas. But this is not a decision of personal interest, it is up to politicians to make the decision," he said, explaining that the idea will be to promote the relationship between Macao and Brazil and then to other Latin American countries, as well as expanding the relationship with Portugal to Spain. "There is no limit. The Macao Forum is complementary. It does not restrict any promotion of the cooperation of the other parts," he said. According to the Macao Government Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai admitted on June 21 that he postponed a trip to Portugal, scheduled for July, and should also pass through Spain and the European Union headquarters in Brussels. Bad interpretations In the same interview with Lusa, the Secretary-General of the Macao Forum imputed to national governments the responsibility for conducting development and economic cooperation policies, stressing that the institution “has no investment projects”. Ji Xianzheng attributes criticism to the Macao Forum to an wrong interpretation regarding the body's mission. "The forum is a mechanism of cooperation between central governments. Many people think it is to the secretariat that it is up to the execution of policies, but we have a limited number of people," added Ji. "The secretariat has no investment projects, it is a mechanism for preparing the ministerial conference, connecting with governments, not a promotion agency. It has not been thought of, connects with the promotion agencies. We are four people sent by China and one delegate for each country," he said. At the last ministerial conference, in April 2024, then Portuguese Economy Minister Pedro Reis argued that the Portuguese Language China-Parais Cooperation and Development Fund should bet more on small and medium enterprises (SMEs). The Cooperation Fund was created in 2013 by the China Development Bank and the Macao Industrial and Commercial Development Fund, with a thousand million dollars, of which about 60 percent have already been invested, according to the secretary general. Action plans Ji Xianzheng has admitted that SMEs are "a difficult theme for any government" and that "international cooperation for the promotion of development and cooperation of small and medium enterprises is even more difficult. It is a topic that is being debated daily worldwide." But admitted, "here, little." "But it is stipulated in the action plan [2024-2026]. It is up to central governments and commerce chambers, promotion agents, to work together to do this. The secretariat assumes responsibility as authorized by the central governments, specifically, in the activities program," he said. Politicians from various countries, including Portugal, Angola and Mozambique, have appealed to a change in the rules of the fund's candidacy. Current rules require, for example, that candidate projects have a minimum investment of five million dollars, and the fund only covers 20 percent of total investment, referring the rest to governments or companies. Ji Xianzheng said the new fund's new direction "is committed to promoting a broader investment, with better coverage for all forum countries, [relatively] to projects that have a strategic or significant impact on the socioeconomic development of participating countries." According to the secretary general, "the terms of application [of the rules of access to the background] will be more flexible and the forms of application will also be more diverse." “Instead of being just direct investment, they are also studying ways to apply the fund, in cooperation with other funds or with other financial institutions,” he gave as an example. "This fund has an operation according to market rules. It is not a humanitarian aid fund. Therefore, it has to guarantee the minimum return of benefit. But, on that, they are very open to study, if by case the conditions of each project," added Ji Xianzheng, but to give examples of "flexibility of rules." Regarding the approximation of the China universe and countries of the Iberian Peninsula, already cemented in official speeches, economist Maria Fernanda Ilhéu, president of the Seda's New Route Association, told HM, earlier this month, that this intention is “very objective and pragmatic and can be summarized to the Macao economy diversification project, for which companies and investors are not only in Macao, but also from Macao, but also from Macao, but also from countries, but countries Portuguese Language ”. "But the fact is that companies and institutions from Portuguese-speaking countries are not being effective in responding to this need for Macao. Therefore, widening companies and Spanish-speaking institutions this invitation to cooperation seems logical to me," the economist said.

item.title: Isabel Rio Novo, author of the biography of Luís de Camões: “Time in Macau was of tranquility”
item.description:
It will be launched tomorrow, at the Consulate General of Portugal in Macau and Hong Kong, the biography of Luís de Camões, by Isabel Rio Novo. In an interview with HM, the author unravels some secrets about the poet's life in Macau, a period of relative calm in the middle of a almost always turbulent life
Why did you decide to get in the writing of another biography of Camões? It is true that Luis Vaz de Camões has been biographed many times over 500 years. However, 50 years ago there was no biography about him. From my point of view and the editor, Camões deserved a more current biography that revised all kinds of prejudices, seeking known sources, the uncovered information research and where the rereading of all previous works were rereading. This biography is not only a summary, but also the reinterpretation of what has been known, but which had rarely been related. The book also brings some new data with some documentation that was discovered. How was your relationship with the writing of Camões born? I fell in love and went to those young readers who was not tormented with Camões. On the contrary, I liked it soon and let myself be seduced by Camões Lyric. I am from the areas of comparative literature and history, and in this sense I always understood the dimension and importance of the work of Camões. And what are they? It is a work and an author of its time and its time, which was extraordinary, with the Renaissance, Humanism and the travels of navigation. But at the same time, it is a work that is the product of an outstanding literary genius, one that we can tell a handful in the history of universal literature. What camões we find in this biography? I tried to go to the bottom, remove layers of the meaning that these 500 years were adding to Camões, in the sense that each season read its Camões and produced its interpretation. I wanted to discover the substrate, the man of flesh and bone he lived and wrote 500 years ago. He was a man suffered, with many financial difficulties. He was a man with a complex and difficult relationship with reality, not only of his time, but also with reality [itself]. The theme of the time, the disconcerting of the world, how society seems to work instead of what should work, being a literary topic of the Renaissance, it was something Camões felt personal and genuinely. How? He lived a series of disagreements, of extreme experiences. Suffice it to say that you have been stuck several times and for various reasons. He made great trips at a time when these were absolutely risky, long, and complicated enterprises. Camões was involved in military expeditions, and almost all his life was soldered. But this set of experiences allowed him to be almost everything someone could be at the time he lived. He was one of the most traveled authors of the time, having been in Brazil, Goa… Yes. Even the connection to Macau, which is contested by some scholars, but not by me… I am persuaded, given the existing documentation and indirect testimonies, which Camões passed through China with the position of Dead and Missing Provider. When this happened, albeit very incipiently, the Portuguese establishment in China, which was already Macao. It is not known whether Camões held this position assigned to him by Viceroy D. Francisco Coutinho, if he was exactly assigned to be a provider during the trip, or a provider at Macao's establishment. But what he knew from China was surely this little warehouse that Portugal had achieved, at a lot of cost, with great difficulty and after many attempts to obtain in China. What did a deceased provider? Whenever a Portuguese died in the East, a soldier or merchant, it was necessary to ensure the rights of the heirs, the families who were normally in Portugal. The provider had to identify the deceased, his naturalness, origin and make the heirs known. He also had to keep the deceased's assets before they were stolen, auction them, keep the coins that would result in, and then take it all to Lisbon. It was a process that, if it went well, took many months, because it was necessary to send this money to the authorities of Goa who later sent him in the career from India to Lisbon. Can we talk about a period of stability in Camões's life in Macau? Yes. Until this appointment as a deceased provider, everything Camões knew from the East had been as a soldier. As soon as Goa [1553] arrives weeks later in a first military expedition. We know why: Not because I had some war appeal, but because only participating in expeditions earned your welding. Although everyone said that the soldiers lived very poorly, the welding was what Camões had to survive. The time lived in Macao, when he was free from soldier obligations, was a time of tranquility regarding subsistence, which was assured. He had some time and calm to continue the work with "the Lusíadas." More than that, as much as the sources allow to deduce, Camões met in Macau a phase of balance in terms of personal and loving life, as, on the return trip, he brought with him, according to the testimony of Diogo do Couto, a Chinese girl. Dinamene. This was the term used by the chronicler. We don't know if it would be a Chinese or Asian girl. This girl with whom Camões lived maritally was someone who liked it very much, according to the testimony of Diogo do Couto. But Dinamene would certainly not be her name, as it was a mythological name that, by the way, Camões used in her lyric, even before she boarded the East. item.title: Filipe de Saavedra, Teacher: “A Camões Interpretative Center in Macau is missing”
item.description:
Professor at the University of Science and Technology of Macao and a scholar of the presence of Camões in Asia, Philip de Saavedra understands that Macau is missing an interpretative center about the poet's life and work. The academic spoke yesterday at the National Library in Lisbon, about the correspondence written by Luís de Camões in Asia
He participated yesterday at the “from Lisbon to Goa: What the Letters of Camões” participated. What path does the East arise portrayed in these letters, and who were directed? The letters Camões wrote from Asia are in the order of the dozens. There is in them scholarship, philosophy, and also a lot of humor, sarcasm, and satire of humanist nature. Some were written from Ternate, others from Malaca, Macau, probably others from Cambodia, to recipients in India and Portugal. With the exception of the letters of Goa, where the identification of the writing site is generally present, maping those that were written during the rest of it would be a complex task. They are only given as written in Asia. Can you give examples of written letters in this context? I mention here two of the first he sent to the kingdom. The epistle whose first line is “The Poet Simony speaking” was written in January 1554, when Camões has just arrived in Goa, destined for his pupil, D. António de Noronha. It is a very emotional letter, giving it the storm that had plagued the Armada in the Cape of Good Hope, "seeing the death of the before me." Camões survived this limit experience aboard the São Bento ship, the only one to arrive that year to Goa, and which was lost in the turn of the Christmas lands, dying in this second bid the Captain Fernão de Álvares Cabral, and many of those who traveled with him. In addition to the news of his salvation, the poet was equally eager to tell his friend the expedition of D. Afonso de Noronha to Malabar, in which he had taken part in the previous month. In Irenal pages, Camões vehemently condemns the massacre of the few native troops by the “thick armed” of the disproportionate vice-king army. In his radical compliment of peace, the poet calls "true remedy" to the early death that cure the war crazes of those who want to live "by knights", for "who will walk by following the fero Mars always brings their eyes to their danger." Cruelly prophetic words: by irony of fate, at the moment the poet wrote these lines and sent them, that recipient diletus, for whose life he feared, already lay, lying during a military foray in Ceuta on April 29, 1553, only 17 years old. And the second letter? A year later, in January 1555, he wrote to a friend a different epistle in tone and in purpose, whose first line is "I wished so much", where he evoked the shock he suffered from the death of D. António, gathering a sonnet that had composed to his memory. It is clear that Camões also had great intimacy with this correspondent, who knew D.
